sub_topic: The construction of the Sierpinski tetrahedron.
message_1: What is the volume of the Sierpinski tetrahedron after six iterations if the original tetrahedron has a volume of 1?
message_2:
The Sierpinski tetrahedron is a fractal created by repeatedly removing smaller tetrahedra from the original tetrahedron. In each iteration, the volume removed is 1/4 of the remaining volume.

After the first iteration, the volume is 1 - 1/4 = 3/4.
After the second iteration, the volume is 3/4 - 3/16 = 9/16.
After the third iteration, the volume is 9/16 - 9/64 = 27/64.
After the fourth iteration, the volume is 27/64 - 27/256 = 81/256.
After the fifth iteration, the volume is 81/256 - 81/1024 = 243/1024.
After the sixth iteration, the volume is 243/1024 - 243/4096 = 729/4096.

So, the volume of the Sierpinski tetrahedron after six iterations is 729/4096.
